text:
as you can probably guess working in a restaurant 
forces you to work faster so today I want to share

with you five tips that I've learned from my 
experience that I hope you make your cooking

more efficient and faster and trust me it's a good 
feeling when you finish cooking a lot faster than

you thought you would so tip number one sharp 
knife invest in a sharpening stone your knife

doesn't have to be expensive but it's important 
that it's sharp you'll be amazed how much faster

your cooking goes when your knife just slide 
through it's like swimming downstream rather

than up so if your knife swishes your tomato 
before you don't cut it it's probably time tip

number two a bench scraper a nifty little tool 
that doesn't cost very much but saves you a

lot of time and you got to move something from 
here so there tip number three have a garbage

bowl right by your workstation it's rather than 
having to every time take your garbage and turn

around and walk it over to the garbage something 
always falls on the floor on the way you can just

put it there continue cooking deal with this at 
the very end remember the less movement changes

you make while you're cooking it the more time 
it saves here tip number four always have a wet

towel or a wet paper towel under your cutting 
board beyond the fact that it's safer when your

voice not moving while you're cutting it also 
saves a lot of time when you're not constantly

changing your board around the counter when you're 
cutting remember a stable surface makes for a fast

and efficient cutting and then when you're done 
you can always use this to clean your counter and

finally tip number five plan your cooking it's 
a little step that have save you a lot of time

so before you start your equipment we'll run 
through what you have to do what order is best

to do it in and if there's anything that can be 
done at the same time remember too that you don't

always need to have everything cut up and ready 
to go before you can start cooking for example

I often have my onion or garlic or whatever slow 
cooking on low heat in the background while I'm

cutting other things that's going in afterwards 
but we're trying to avoid this idle time this

standing and stirring something for five minutes 
that doesn't need to be stirred but only because

you've got nothing else to do and if nothing 
else you can always clean while something else
